alert.note: Alert for Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 11:32PM CDT until June 28 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kay County in northern Oklahoma... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1132 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Chilocco, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Blackwell, Newkirk, Kaw City, Braman, Kildare, Chilocco, Kaw Lake, Hardy, Blackwell Lake, and Peckham. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging wind and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
